intro: Pleonotoma brittonii, commonly known as the Britton's pleonotoma, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions such as reduced leaf size and deep root systems. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, contributing to its role in pollination by attracting various insects. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance in its native habitat.
